sentences.english: It's for these reasons that the MP5 is the favorite among counter-terrorists and police forces worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 因此MP5受到世界範圍內的反恐和警力部隊的青睞。

sentences.english: It is said that about 10 000 policemen are posted along this section of the railway line.
sentences.chinese: 據說鐵路沿線這一段佈置着一萬警力。

sentences.english: Security has been noticeably increased in recent weeks at the city's airports and foreign consulates.
sentences.chinese: 近幾周來，上海的機場和外國領館區明顯增加了警力。

sentences.english: A senior European Union official has condemned the excessive use of police force against anti-government protesters in Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 歐盟高級官員譴責土耳其濫用警力鎮壓反政府抗議者。

sentences.english: Morgen: Every available cop in the state is out looking for your daughter.
sentences.chinese: 州里能調出的警力都在外面找你的女兒。

sentences.english: Team see the time is ripe, immediately start mobilizing police officer.
sentences.chinese: 專案組見時機成熟，馬上調集警力展開圍捕行動。

sentences.english: Then thousands of army troops stepped in late Friday to reinforce the police.
sentences.chinese: 之後數錢軍隊週五晚開始介入幫助警力。

definition: to deploy surveillance/to put under surveillance
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
police classification/subdivision of policing activities (traffic, border guard, criminal etc)
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
